byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Helene Cooper from Washington.
byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and MUJIB MASHAL

abstract: Taliban forces hold northern city of Kunduz, Afghanistan, surrounding airport where government forces and civilians have retreated as government fails to mount counteroffensive; United States forces carry out airstrikes against insurgents, increasing their involvement in conflict that has seemingly become out of Afghan government's control.
lead_paragraph: After a promised counterattack against the Taliban fell apart, the U.S. conducted at least two airstrikes to assist the government.

headline.main: Afghan Crisis Grows as Push to Retake Kunduz From Taliban Fails
headline.print_headline: Counterattack by Afghans Fails; Airport Besieged

snippet: After a promised counterattack against the Taliban fell apart, the U.S. conducted at least two airstrikes to assist the government.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
